results.title: Rail town
results.creator_credit: Eric Thompson, Joan Long and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Dramatises the activities and life of the people of Port Augusta, South Australia, with emphasis on the significance of this city as a railhead linking the Eastern States with the West and the Northern Territory.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Eric Thompson, Joan Long and Australian National Film Board

results.title: A Race of horses
results.creator_credit: Kit Denton, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.brief_description: Shows without commentary the breeding and training of racehorses in Australia. Includes scenes of foaling, breaking-in and handling the young horses, and an actual race sequence. Photographed by renown cameraman Dean Semler.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Kit Denton, Don Murray and Film Australia
results.description: Shows without commentary the breeding and training of racehorses in Australia. Includes scenes of foaling, breaking-in and handling the young horses, and an actual race sequence. Photographed by renown cameraman Dean Semler.

results.title: RAAF Record. Newsreel No. 07
results.creator_credit: Stanley Brogden and Australia. Royal Australian Air Force. Directorate of Public Relations
results.brief_description: Cinemagazine newsreel includes the following: 1. The RAAF flight in the Antarctic use Canadian “Beaver” aircraft. 2. RAAF personnel are trained by firemen in Melbourne. 3. The Lockheed Hercules transport. 4. The “Jindivik” pilotless aircraft, designed and built in Australia, shown in flight at Woomera range.

results.creator_credit: Stanley Dalby, Roland Beckett and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Public enemies
results.creator_credit: Geoffrey Collings, Department of Information and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: Vividly shows the consequences of acts of vandalism in Australian cities, with particular emphasis on vandalism by adolescents of Post Office property.

results.title: Project: Public Service
results.creator_credit: Shan Benson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit
results.brief_description: The Commonwealth Public Service as seen through the eyes of a school-boy preparing a project book on the work of the Service. The film also briefly outlines the functioning of the parliamentary system and role of the public servants.
results.creator_credit_for_label: Shan Benson and Australian Commonwealth Film Unit

results.title: Presidential tour
results.brief_description: The President of the U.S.A., Lyndon B. Johnson, and Mrs. Johnson visit Australia in October, 1966. Scenes in Canberra, Melbourne, Sydney, Brisbane and Townsville.

results.title: Power from the snow
results.creator_credit: Gunnar Isakson, John Martin-Jones and Australian National Film Board
results.brief_description: A survey of the Snowy Mountains Hydroelectric Scheme. Shows the commencement of work in 1949, surveying the area and design of the first part of the project. Culminates in the official opening by the Prime Minister of the new Munyang Power Station, a few miles downstream from Guthega Dam which supplies it with water. Work continues on this great project, estimated to take twenty-five years to complete. Over an area of 3,000 square miles, men and machines reshape the land to supply Australia with light, and power.

results.title: Posting Woomera
results.creator_credit: Australia. Army. Public Relations Film Unit
results.brief_description: A survey of the rocket research and testing being carried out at Woomera Rocket Range, South Australia. Housing, recreational activities and other amenities are also shown.
